data.title: The 95+ Best Movies With Side in the Title
data.meta_description: The 95+ Best Movies With Side in the Title, as voted on by fans. Current Top 3: The Blind Side, Journey to the Far Side of the Sun, The Other Side of ...
data.text:
How many movies with side in the title can you name? This list ranks the best movies with side in the name, whether they're documentaries, dramas, horror movies, or any other genre of film. Do you have a favorite movie with side in the title? Categorizing movies by words in their titles is kind of uncommon, but that's a big part of why this list is so fun to scroll through. There's probably one movie with side in the title you think of right away, but you might be shocked to see how many others exist as well.

Notable films with side in the title include West Side Story, The Blind Side, and Master and Commander: The Far Side of the World, although there are many more examples on this list. This poll is interactive, meaning you can vote the side movies up or down depending on how much you like them.

Sandra Bullock, Tim McGraw, Quinton Aaron

Based on the remarkable true story of NFL player Michael Oher, this inspiring tale follows a homeless African-American teen who finds a new life and family when he is taken in by a caring woman and her husband. As they introduce him to opportunity and love, Oher's world expands, and he begins to tap into his incredible natural talents for football, ultimately becoming a professional athlete. This heartwarming film showcases the power of determination, selflessness, and human connection in overcoming adversity.

Released : 2009

Directed by : John Lee Hancock

Dig Deeper Quietly Racist Things You Probably Missed In 'The Blind Side'

Also ranks # 48 on Great Historical Black Movies Based On True Stories

Also ranks # 24 on Great Movies That Take Place In Autumn

In this innovative science fiction classic, a manned spacecraft is sent on a three-week mission to investigate an unknown planet believed to exist behind the sun. Upon arrival, the astronauts are shocked to discover that the mirror-image planet is an eerie replica of Earth inhabited by doubles of themselves. The film expertly explores themes of identity, isolation, and highlights the idea that even in the vastness of space, human nature remains paramount.

Released : 1969

Directed by : Robert Parrish

This thought-provoking documentary offers a unique perspective on the lives, struggles, and motivations of Mexican immigrants who risk everything to cross the US-Mexico border in search of a better life. Based on interviews with a diverse range of individuals from rural Mexico, the film provides insight into the economic and social factors that drive people to make the dangerous journey. It serves as a powerful reminder of the complex human stories behind immigration statistics and policies.

Released : 2009

Directed by : Roy Germano

Natalie Wood, Richard Beymer, Russ Tamblyn

A masterpiece of American cinema, this iconic musical reimagines Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet against the backdrop of 1950s New York City, where rival street gangs - the Jets and the Sharks - vie for territory and respect. Amidst the tension and strife, a forbidden love blossoms between Tony, a Jet, and Maria, the sister of the Shark's leader. This groundbreaking film combines unforgettable music, breathtaking dance sequences, and a poignant story of love and tragedy that still resonates with audiences today.

Released : 1961

Directed by : Jerome Robbins, Robert Wise

Dig Deeper The Behind-The-Scenes Of 'West Side Story' Was Plagued With More Hatred Than The Movie Itself

And Deeper Movies That Won Best Picture at the Oscars and Golden Globes

Also ranks # 68 on The Best Movies For Date Night

Adapted from the award-winning novel by Jean Craighead George, this family adventure film follows a young boy named Sam who decides to leave his family's crowded apartment in New York City and live off the land in the wilderness. With only his pet falcon Frightful for company, Sam learns to survive and thrive in his new environment, finding strength and self-reliance within himself. The movie captures the wonder and beauty of nature while providing an inspiring message for young viewers about resilience and independence.

Released : 1969

Directed by : James B. Clark

This chilling sequel to the 1982 horror classic dives deeper into the supernatural forces haunting the Freeling family after their harrowing escape from the haunted house. As they attempt to rebuild their lives, the malevolent spirits return, luring young Carol Anne into a dangerous alternate reality. Aided by a team of paranormal experts, the Freelings must once more confront the terrifying other side to save their daughter from the sinister forces at play.

Released : 1986

Directed by : Brian Gibson
